The standard NEAT approach for adding nodes is to split a connection, e.g.

1------>2
Split connection to give
1---->3---->2

I was wondering if splitting nodes would have additional worth. E.g.

(1,2,3) ---> 4 ---> (5,6,7)
Split 4 to give:
(1,2,3) ---> 4 ---> 8 ---> (5,6,7)

So 4 became 4 and 8 with a connection between them. One notable change
this allows is for lots of connections coming into an output node to
be split away into a hidden node adjacent to the output.

(1,2,3) ---> out
Split output node:
(1,2,3) ---> 4 ---> out

Same for an input:
in ----> (1,2,3)
Split input node:
in ---> 4 ---> (1,2,3)


Any thoughts?

Colin.
